page.title: 19NAIRN:THE PEOPLE
page.content: Nairnites are very much like the rest of Scots but are probably more conservative than most as might be expected in a small town. A fair number of people attend church. Most are Presbyterian but there are also Roman Catholics and Episcopalians. Much of our area has 'incomers' often attracted by work at the nearby oil platform construction yard and these people have diluted what must have been a close knit well structured community. Nairn's dialect is close to but distinct from that of Inverness.It contrasts markedly with that of North_east Scotland. Likewise the people (locals and incomers alike) have a friendly, laid-back approach which is quite different from towns to the east.
